  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ManagementCompany()
    Creates a ManagementCompany object using empty strings, creates a default Plot with maximum width and depth and it initializes the properties array.

    Creates a ManagementCompany object using the given values, creates a default Plot with maximum width and depth and it initializes the properties array.
    ManagementCompany(String name, String taxID, double mgmFee, int x, int y, int width, int depth)
    Creates a ManagementCompany object using the given values creates a Plot using the given values and it initializes the properties array.
    ManagementCompany(ManagementCompany otherCompany)
    Creates a new ManagementCompany copy of the given ManagementCompany.

  • Constructor Details

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany()
      Creates a ManagementCompany object using empty strings, creates a default Plot with maximum width and depth and it initializes the properties array.

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany(String name, String taxID, double mgmFee)
      Creates a ManagementCompany object using the given values, creates a default Plot with maximum width and depth and it initializes the properties array.
      Parameters:
      name - management Company name
      taxID - tax Id
      mgmFee - management Fee

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany(String name, String taxID, double mgmFee, int x, int y, int width, int depth)
      Creates a ManagementCompany object using the given values creates a Plot using the given values and it initializes the properties array. This constructor should call an appropriate existing constructor.
      Parameters:
      name - management Company name
      taxID - tax Id
      mgmFee - management Fee

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany(ManagementCompany otherCompany)
      Creates a new ManagementCompany copy of the given ManagementCompany. This constructor should call an appropriate existing constructor.

  • Method Details

    • addProperty

      public int addProperty(String name, String city, double rent, String owner)
      Adds a new property to the properties array, this method should call an appropriate existing overloaded method.
      Parameters:
      name - property name
      city - city where the property is located
      rent - rent amount
      owner - the owner's name
      Returns:
      -1 if the array is full, -2 if the Property object is null, -3 if management company does not encompass the property plot, -4 if property plot overlaps ANY of properties in array, otherwise return the index of the array where the property was added.

    • addProperty

      public int addProperty(String name, String city, double rent, String owner, int x, int y, int width, int depth)
      Adds a new property to the properties array, this method should call an appropriate existing overloaded method.
      Parameters:
      name - property name
      city - city where the property is located
      rent - rent amount
      owner - the owner's name
      x - The x coordinate of the plot
      y - The y coordinate of the plot
      width - The width coordinate of the plot
      depth - The depth coordinate of the plot
      Returns:
      -1 if the array is full, -2 if the Property object is null, -3 if management company does not encompass the property plot, -4 if property plot overlaps ANY of properties in array, otherwise return the index of the array where the property was added.

    • addProperty

      public int addProperty(Property property)
      Creates a property object by copying from another property and adds it to the properties array.
      Returns:
      -1 if the array is full, -2 if the Property object is null, -3 if management company does not encompass the property plot, -4 if property plot overlaps ANY of properties in array, otherwise return the index of the array where the property was added.

    • removeLastProperty

      public void removeLastProperty()
      Removes(nullifies) the LAST property in the properties array

    • isPropertiesFull

      public boolean isPropertiesFull()
      Checks if the properties array has reached the maximum capacity
      Returns:
      true if properties array is full, false otherwise

    • getPropertiesCount

      public int getPropertiesCount()
      Gets the number of existing properties in the array
      Returns:
      the number of existing properties in the array

    • getTotalRent

      public double getTotalRent()
      Returns the total rent of the properties in the properties array *
      Returns:
      total rent

    • getHighestRentProperty

      public Property getHighestRentProperty()
      Gets the property in the array with the maximum amount of rent
      Returns:
      the property in the array which has the highest amount of rent

    • getHighestRentPropertyIndex

      private int getHighestRentPropertyIndex()
      Returns the index of the property with the maximum rent amount. * NOTE: For simplicity assume that each "Property" object's rent amount is different.
      Returns:
      the index of the property with the maximum rent amount

    • isMangementFeeValid

      public boolean isMangementFeeValid()
      Checks if the management company has a valid (between 0-100) fee
      Returns:
      true of the management fee is valid (between 0-100), false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Represents the information of all the properties in the properties array.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      information of ALL the properties within this management company by accessing the properties array. This value should include each management company's name, taxID as well each property's name,city,owner,rent Amount
